ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about public health modeling and how to estimate the cost-benefit profile of public health interventions.
understanding basics of modeling studies
better understanding of the limitations of the current types of modeling studies in widespread use
Conceptual and observation of a survey of public health modeling concepts and an overview of their utility
Well-rounded PH modeling knowledges that cover different angles
Public health modeling techniques and its applications.
I developed a rudimentary understanding of how to apply probability and statistics to complex forces and influences that drive public health.  This was a fascinating subject and I hope to learn more.
The basics of modeling concepts used in public health, what goes into these models, and how to interpret these models effectively.

I learned a lot about public modeling that I didn't think I would be able to learn. I'm certainly not an expert, but I think I have a much deeper understanding of how it all works, and I'll read journal articles in a completely different way now.
I developed a survey style understanding of modeling concepts.
I learned more about probability and new knowledge of Markov models, contagion models, model dynamics and Bayesian theory and decision trees.

narratives.question_text: What actions did you take that helped your learning in this course?
comments: As always with more technical classes, I kept my work (reading and assignments) on schedule and took advantage of all OH to make sure I had a thorough understanding of each week materials.
videos, lectures,homework
working through the problems with classmates/the TA
Rewatch lectures and compare homework answers to answer keys - also diving in and experimenting with provided code was smoother than trying to digest lecture content extensively first
Repeatedly listening to the models
I tried to explore and search more about the models and its applications to learn and understand the core concepts
Attended class, watched lectures while diligently taking notes, completed the readings, and dedicated time to the homework problems.
Attend live lectures, watch office hours recordings that I couldn't attend, watch pre-recorded lectures

The key was to do the homework, attend office hours, and ask questions. On the homework, It also helped me to work with other students and talk problems through with them. We often did this during office hours and it was really beneficial.
I reviewed the videos and the TA videos.
Reached out for help when I needed it, attended study hours and completed all but one homework assignment.
